citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
On April 5th, 2024, the IACUC conducted a Post Approval Monitoring (PAM) survey of a baboon user laboratory. The
PAM members reviewed all the activities under the IACUC approved protocol (#NPH022). Following the review, the PAM
survey determined the following observations/deviations in the approved protocol:
-Vascular Endothlial Growth Factor Gene was delivered alone rather than with estradiol.
-Biopsy of the vastus lateralis skeletal muscle was only obtained in the baboon offspring at 4 years of age. The protocol
stated that a biopsy of the vastus lateralis skeletal muscle should be completed on the baboon offspring at 1 year, 2 year
and 4 years old.
-Cationic Microbubbles and Definity contrast agents were administered at a higher dose than what was written in the
approved protocol.
-Carprofen was administered subcutaneously (SC) for surgical procedures rather than intramuscular (IM) as described in
the approved protocol.
-Buprenorphine was administered pre-emptively and post-operatively for survival surgeries. The approved protocol
indicates that buprenorphine should only be administered post-operatively.
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve,
require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and
use of animals in ongoing activities.
Corrected before the time of inspection through corrective action plan.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
This inspection was conducted July 1, 2024 to July 3, 2024.
Additional Inspectors:
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7)  Repeat
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
On April 5th, 2024, the IACUC conducted a Post Approval Monitoring (PAM) survey of a baboon user laboratory. The 
PAM members reviewed all the activities under the IACUC approved protocol (#NPH022). Following the review, the PAM 
survey determined the following observations/deviations in the approved protocol:  
 
-Vascular Endothlial Growth Factor Gene was delivered alone rather than with estradiol. 
 
-Biopsy of the vastus lateralis skeletal muscle was only obtained in the baboon offspring at 4 years of age. The protocol 
stated that a biopsy of the vastus lateralis skeletal muscle should be completed on the baboon offspring at 1 year, 2 year 
and 4 years old. 
 
-Cationic Microbubbles and Definity contrast agents were administered at a higher dose than what was written in the 
approved protocol.  
 
-Carprofen was administered subcutaneously (SC) for surgical procedures rather than intramuscular (IM) as described in 
the approved protocol. 
 
-Buprenorphine was administered pre-emptively and post-operatively for survival surgeries. The approved protocol 
indicates that buprenorphine should only be administered post-operatively.  
 
With respect to activities involving animals, the IACUC, as an agent of the research facility, shall review and approve, 
require modifications (to secure approval), or withhold approval of proposed significant changes regarding the care and 
use of animals in ongoing activities.  
 
Corrected before the time of inspection through corrective action plan.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
This inspection was conducted July 1, 2024 to July 3, 2024. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
GLORIA MCFADDEN, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
